net.canarymod.tasks

Class ServerTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.canarymod.tasks.ServerTask
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeleteWorldCommand.DeleteWorldTask

    public abstract class ServerTask
extends java.lang.Object
    Server Task

    Extend this class to add synchronized tasks to the Server queue.
    Task are set to execute along with the Server's main thread.
    Exact timing is not guaranteed, and based on how often the Server ticks.

    Author:
    Jason (darkdiplomat)
    See Also:
    ServerTaskManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerTask

        public ServerTask(TaskOwner owner,
                  long delay)
        Constructs a one-time use ServerTask
        Parameters:
        owner - the TaskOwner of the task, typically a Plugin
        delay - the delay before executing. Set to 0 or less to run within the next Server tick (Roughly once every 50 milliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if owner is null

      • ServerTask

        public ServerTask(TaskOwner owner,
                  long delay,
                  boolean continuous)
        Constructs either a one-time use or continuous ServerTask
        Parameters:
        owner - the TaskOwner of the task, typically a Plugin
        delay - the delay before executing. Set to 0 or less to run within the next Server tick
        If delay is 0 or less, the task will run with each server tick
        continuous - true for continuous; false for one-time use
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if owner is null

      • ServerTask

        public ServerTask(TaskOwner owner,
                  long delay,
                  long schedule,
                  boolean continuous)
        Constructs either a one-time use or continuous ServerTask
        Parameters:
        owner - the TaskOwner of the task, typically a Plugin
        delay - the delay before executing. Set to 0 or less to run within the next Server tick
        If delay is 0 or less, the task will run with each server tick
        schedule - the delay before each execution if the task is continuous If delay is 0 or less, the task will run with each server tick
        continuous - true for continuous; false for one-time use
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if owner is null

        public final boolean isContinuous()
